A mistake that easily could've been a learning experience but the owner blew out of proportion in front of my partner and I and made a FOOL of himself. I will never spend another cent there and there are more authentic Mexican restaurants in Streetsboro.

Si, señor! Luchita's is muy, muy delicioso.

First of all, the service was enough to make this a ten star experience. I have no idea how anyone has had anything but amazing service here, but all I can say is, hells yea. 

Secondly, the never-ending, stuff-me-to-death, awesome bowl of chips and salsa didn't hurt. I loved the texture and spice of the salsa as well. Some may argue that it's not the "best salsa in Cleveland", but I say, shut it. It's freaking tasty and I finished at least two bowls by myself. 

Third, hello margs in my face. The bartender asked us what kind of tequila we'd like and filled those suckers up! I mean, so strong that you could have probably lit my breath on fire. Hot damn. Combine that with super-swift refills and you have one bubbly, tipsy blonde. 

Our entrees came up super quickly and we both really enjoyed them (see also: stuffed ourselves to oblivion.) The beau had this tasty, shredded chicken dish with a spicy, cream sauce with warm, flour tortillas for wrapping. Although, I just snuck fork-fulls--shhhhhh! Being the indecisive gal I am, I settled on a combination plate of ala cart items. Jason wanted a tostada, and I got a cheese enchilada with both red and green salsas and a beef, Americana taco. Everything was pretty typical, but the salsas were bomb-diggity! I also get a little taste of the sopa, which has inspired a recipe hunt so I can try to make something that yummy at home.

The restaurant itself was very clean and organized, although, yes-- it's dive-y. It really gave the place a local feel and I didn't mind it at all. We saw families, folks on dates and people grabbing take-out. There's certainly something for everyone here.

My boss gave me a gift card for Luchita's as a graduation gift when I completed my master's program. I was super excited to try it since she raved about it and a few other people had told me great things. Needless to say I wasn't too impressed. I ordered the beef empanadas and my sister ordered the pork with onions. In my opinion the food didn't have that authentic Mexican flavor and lacked a lot of seasoning. Another thing that kind of bothered me was how quickly the food came out after we ordered. Made me wonder if what we were getting was being made fresh... Drinks were good and service was good.

I saw a picture of their Friday fish fry dinner on FB and immediately wanted to get me some! I stopped by after work and since I got there before the fish fry started at 5:30pm I decided to sit at the bar and enjoy their happy hour menu while I waited. Select appetizers were half off so I got the flautas barbacoa ($3.25) and the goat cheese guac ($3.50). Both were pretty tasty, however I would not pay the full price for the guac unless the portion size was increased.   They also give you some chips and salsa (tasted a little hot/spicy to me) to snack on while you wait. Since I got my fish fry to-go and it arrived shortly after the appetizers did, they allowed me to box up the unfinished appetizers (I barely touched them). A young blonde waitress was pretty friendly and the old blonde one seemed pretty cranky. Atmosphere was pleasant and there seemed to be plenty of regulars inside. 

Now the star of the show, the fish fry! ($13). It came with two pieces of fish, chipotle tartar sauce, mac & cheese, cucumber and carrot slaw/salad, and Mexican grilled corn. YUM! The fish was fried perfectly, not too heavy on the batter. The slaw/salad was crisp and refreshing. The mac & cheese was gooey which was awesome. Overall just a very tasty experience and I must say better than the traditionally greasy fried everything fish dinner. I will definitely go back and grab this special while it lasts!
This is the best Mex in the area!  Very fresh and the food is come out hot, not cold on a hot plate.

This reviews comes as a surprise to me as I've heard how good the food is at the Cleveland location..... at the Hudson location, not good.  The bartender who assisted with my pickup order is the only reason this has a two star review. She was very nice and pleasant.  The vegetarian burrito and vegetable enchiladas on the other hand were not. The green sauce came out of a can about 15 seconds prior to being put on the food. The waxy cheese covered mushy corn and I believe flour tortillas.  Vegetarian at this location means I hope you like peppers and onions because that's all your getting.  We are fans of good guacamole and have heard there's was good so we tried it--- threw half of the 2 Oz we were given (for 6.99) away. 95% chunky onion and tomato, and really no flavor.  If the 4 people sitting at a table being the only customers at 6pm on a Thursday night wasn't a clue, the food surely was a sign to avoid Luchita's. 
Sadly.

Spot on authentic Mexican food.  Not the kind of place where you place your order and it comes out 8 minutes later.  I gotta agree w PW about taco Tuesdays and man those enchilada's are great on Weds.  My grandmother would take me here as she lived within walking distance so this place also takes me back to good memories.  The sign out front is an icon in this neighborhood.  They are closed Mondays.  If you like Mole' then you really will like theirs.  This place is as Cleveland as Sokolowski's and should be on everyones "Cleveland places to eat" list

Unlike most Mexican places, the rice and refried beans are vegetarian but the black beans are not!

It's a Mexican place without obvious Mexican people but the food it slightly above average and it's a little more upscale.

This place has great margaritas we had to wait a couple minutes for our table we had a couple margaritas which were great. The chicken mole was very good add to chicken chipotle which was okay. the place was busier than usual we will come back and try it when it's more of a casual relaxed atmosphere but the food was worth stopping in for again.
Hands down my favorite Mexican restaurant! Enchilada night is a must! Cozy and authentic. Parking is sometimes an issue but worth the short walk.  Vegetarian friendly.
After going here numerous times, we've concluded that the food is boring and lacking flavor. Go for the queso and margaritas. Skip the dinner.

Best quesadilla I've had. The Complimentary Chips and salsa were really good too! The waitresses are extremely friendly! I am a frequent luchitas goer and the staff has come to me and vice versa. It's great having a locally owned place that values relationships with customers.

Been here twice now for their Taco Tuesday. My 16yr old son loves their tacos. Margaritas are so so...depends on who is making them. Salsa is great. Fillings on the tacos are a lil skimpy but I guess thats what you get for 99c tacos on Tuesday.  Planning to go back on a Weds for their $2 enchilladas.

While the shine has worn off of this place over the years, Luchita's still manages to deliver a quality meal at a very affordable price. 

There was a time when there was an impossible wait to get in, but that was before Mexican or Mexican inspired cuisine popped up on every fifth corner in Lakewood. Thus is the burden of a popular ethnic food!

Despite possible slip ups and varying quality of subsequently attempted Luchita's locations, this one stands the test of time. What you will find here is a good standard of coastal Mexican fare and a couple Tex-Mex favourites sprinkled in for the uninitiated. There are many items unique to Luchita's that you won't find elsewhere and it is definitely worth the time to peruse the menu and try something new to you.

I haven't been to Luchita's in years. I remember exactly why it's taken me so long to come back to this restaurant during my recent visit.

Luchita's is an authentic Mexican restaurant, you're not going to find any tex-mex dishes here. 

My boyfriend & his son both got the steak fajitas. They were skimpy on the steak that's for sure. Their were more peppers than anything. My boyfriend's daughter got the steak enchiladas & she didn't like it. The steak was too chewy. I got a steak burrito & I wasn't pleased with it. It was flavorless & the steak was very tough. 

The dinner wasn't cheap either yet, the food was pretty mediocre. The only thing I liked was the service & the chips & salsa.
Terrible margaritas.. both mango and lime. Terrible service. Food was awful. I'm surprised they are still competing in the Hudson foodie market.

My friend and I picked this place for dinner, knowing nothing about it other than it served Mexican. Everything we ordered was delicious, and our server was friendly and attentive. The place itself looked kind of haphazard and messy in terms of cleanliness, and there's only one stall for each bathroom.
Really wonderful authentic Mexican fare at reasonable prices. I had been wanting to try this place for a long time, and finally stopped by. Well worth the wait.

I was there about a year ago. Had a glorious beef chimichanga. The food was great, but my only complaint was the service. Now, maybe it was just because we were on the patio, but we waited at least 30-45 mins to get drink orders taken. It seems our waitress may have just left mid-meal also, so we had to keep asking various people for our checks by the end of it. Good food, but I wouldn't go back.

Oh! I almost forgot to mention: one of the most disgusting bathrooms I have ever seen. There was uh, "stuff" everywhere. Pretty nasty.

I so wanted to like Luchita's.  My husband and I went many years back (15, maybe?) and remembered it as very good.  When we saw a Groupon that would save us some money, we decided to revisit it (it's a drive for us, and we chose the West Side location rather than the closer one in Hudson.)  We went to celebrate my husband's birthday.  Sadly, we found little to inspire enthusiasm.  The frozen magaritas seemed good (though expensive) to me, but my husband and his friend thought that the alcohol content was less than it should be for the price.  The food was. . .actually, a step below "meh," although certainly not "eek!"  We ordered different dishes--chile rellenos, a combo plate (enchilada/taco/burrito), and fajitas, as well as appetizers.  The calamari was tough and much less than abundant.  (Sort of like chewing your pencil eraser, if you ever indulged in that in grade school.)  The combo items and chile rellenos were fairly indistinguishable from one another, except that the taco seemed both soggy and stale and that the chile rellenos were overly salty and too cake-y.  The fajitas seemed to include poor quality meat and veggies--my husband complained that we could have made a tastier meal at home.  We tried to improve the flavor of our food by dousing it with salsa.  We asked for the "really hot" salsa which was--let's say three stars out of five when it comes to heat.  

The sole good point was that our server was attentive and friendly.  (Our busboy, however, was very grim and almost depressing!)  We must hold the minority opinion about the food, though--the place was packed by 6 pm on a Friday night, and the noise level rose beyond our tolerance limit.  (We like to hear one another without shouting--and to refrain from hearing those at nearby tables discuss their battles with foot fungus, Montezuma's Revenge, and irritating colleagues.)

Even a much better Groupon would not persuade us to return, I'm afraid.  Our expectations were not very high, but I think we could have done as well at Taco Bell.  (And we don't like Taco Bell!)  Glory is fleeting. . .

If you're in the mood for Mexican and I mean MEXICAN food!!
This place is it!!

This is a small hole in the wall restaurant/bar that isn't fancy, they don't have much art on the wall. 

But, they have amazing food. Like, AMAZING! I love Mexican food, absolutely love it. However, it doesn't love me. Unless if comes from here. 
The goat cheese guacamole is my favorite. I could eat that until I turn....Green. 

This place has got it all. Homemade chios, Salsa and actual authentic Mexican food and great prices.

Awful food, terrible management and atmosphere. Only thing good about this place was how lovely our waitress was.  

Doesn't even deserve 1 star.

For years, we have heard nothing but good things about this location. I once had a terrifying experience at their Hudson location but that is a review previously listed.

Upon giving in to try this place, we are very disappointed. For starters, the service is sub par. I mentioned my food allergy and she almost ignored it with a "mhm" and didn't bother to write it down nor tell the kitchen I'm sure.

The only item worth getting here is the queso, but I still wouldn't bother. We had the enchiladas. All you could taste is the flour tortilla and the pasta sauce they clearly smothered it in. A handful of plain beef and we had what looked like mexican food and tasted like Italian junk. The margaritas were from a slushie machines and taste like something you buy at cedar point.  THEY ALSO CHARGE YOU 50 CENTS FOR A CUP OF CHIPS. 

And they shoved me in the corner like Baby.

All and all, I won't come here again.

After reading several reviews on Yelp!, and knowing the reputation that Luchita's has, I sauntered in for dinner this evening.  The small parking lot across the street was full, and I ended up parking on the side street.  The restaurant is located in a roughly 100-year-old two-story commercial building that screams "neighborhood joint", and the art deco entrance was kind of funky.  

Upon entering, there is a long bar to the left, and several tables in front of you, with the main dining room behind the bar.  The walls were covered with stucco, and were fairly uncluttered, save for a colorful painting on the wall, a hat that had been hung, and a cactus in the window.  

When I arrived, only two tables were available, which was a decent sign for a weeknight.  A bowl of chips and salsa were immediately placed on my table.  The salsa had a little spice to it, but had that nagging not-homemade feeling (I could taste a bit of vinegar, which is oh-so-common in jar salsa).  

I ordered the large combination plate, which consists of your choice of three enchilada/burrito/taco/flauta, rice, and beans.  I always use chicken enchiladas as a measuring stick, so I ordered two of those with salsa verde, and a Taco Mexicano with shredded beef.  

The food easily took 15 minutes to arrive, which is a little scary when you know that components of Mexican food are fairly interchangeable, and the restaurant is not very large.  The salsa verde on my enchiladas was caked-on and bland, with none of the spiciness or tomatillo flavor that i expected.  The corn tortillas were rubbery, and the entire enchilada tasted of nothing but plain, unseasoned chicken.  The rice was garden variety meh, and the refried beans were tinny--straight out of the Old El Paso can.  More bizarrely, my taco was in a deep-fried rolled-up tortilla (taquito, anyone?), and was covered with guacamole and sour cream.  I've never been to Mexico, but I've had tacos--which are traditionally grilled meat, onion, and cilantro, with perhaps some salsa on the side.  This was not traditional, and the beef definitely had some crust on the ends.

Mexican food is supposed to be fresh and simple, and provides an opportunity for fresh salsas to shine.  Sadly, none of these were present during my meal.  Honestly, I've had better Mexican food in the middle of South Carolina.  I expect better from a longtime stalwart in Cleveland.  

The only reason I didn't give Luchita's one star was because the staff was genuinely nice.  I save one-star ratings only for the absolute worst of the worst .  I think Luchita's is just a victim of Americanized Mexican food and cutting corners.  For shame.

Such a great neighborhood staple. The food is consistently delicious, and the bartenders are outgoing and friendly. I really like the Mexico City tacos and I suspect they might even be slightly healthy. The chicken soup and tostadas de tinga are can't-misses!

The lady friend and I were in the mood for some Mexican this weekend and decided to try this place out. I had never heard of it and nor had she. When I saw it on Yelp I thought that the atmosphere looked to be a significant step up from most other Mexican restaurants in the area and we weren't disappointed when we arrived, however, the disappointments started shortly there after. 

-No one checked on our table after we were seated for nearly ten minutes. (Not even for water or drinks and we were sitting outside in the heat). 

-Service was TERRIBLE. The wait staff checked in on us once after we received our food. Our drinks sat empty for 15 minutes. I tried to stop our waitress as she walked by and she completely ignored me. 

-The food was bland overall.

-When we were finished I had to flag someone on the waitstaff for our check, who wasn't even our waitress, who brought over the checks, then our waitress came back by to pickup the tip.

Not too sure if it was the specific waitress we had or what, but she seemed really disengaged with the whole idea of just helping us as people, much less provide good customer service. 

Really really disappointing.

Worst mexican food ever! I order fajitas and not sure what i received. It was not edible. Looked more like soup. The chicken was cold and way too much liquid. Looked more like stir fry with a side of baby poo. Normally fajitas come and you have to assemble them but i am pretty sure this was lartially digested already. I took two bites and could not bring myself to eat any more. Absolutely inedible!

Luchita' s restaurant is in a great location on the square. We arrived about 6 pm on a Saturday. They were fairly busy but we were seated rather quickly. They have a great bar area and a lot of draft options. The salsa and chips were excellent. The chicken in by burrito was fresh white meat and not your typical shredded dark meat. The rice and beans were very good as well. 

For dessert there are several options for ice cream or yogurt on the square. Have fun!

Luchita's has been around since the 80's! I used to come here as a child with my family back in the day in the 90's and it was always delicious. I remember the sign with man with the sombrero as a kid and it always made me smile and want to go back.

I've been here several times since my youth and it's always delicious! The place is on point with their Mexican food. The sopa azteca is fantastic. I love the broth with the chicken and avocado. You can't go wrong and I have to get it every time. I love the enchiladas with the green sauce and the empanadas are delicious and crispy. 

Place is great for Tuesdays also for Taco Tuesday. They have 99 cent tacos and they are a great deal. Also on Wednesdays they have $2 enchiladas.

I love coming here for happy hour also. They make a strong margarita and it's fantastic. Perfect balance of sour and tequila. It's not too sour to the point where it's gross. It's the exact right amount and packs a punch!

Service is always quick and the people are very kind and welcoming here. It's a staple in the neighborhood and just has such a cozy feel to it. It's nothing fancy but feels welcoming and I will always keep coming back and talking this place up!

Worst place ever! Food has no flavor and they serve small amounts. You do not get the Mexican Culture Vibe. There's way better restaurants. Don't waste your time. Unless you're not familiar with real Mexican food,  I could see why you would think this place is great.  Smh

Stopped in here last Saturday after another prime spot for our local friends was found to have closed or moved.  Luchita's was hopping and on a wait, be we managed to snag some bar seats.  Bartender asked the entire bar to move down to accommodate our group of four.  She was completely slammed, but had a nice routine for treating the entire bar as one big party.  Always encouraging to see someone doing things correctly in the weeds.
Chips and salsa were pretty great, which is sadly critical for us in moments like these.  We were very hungry and made the old college mistake of eating too many chips.  Food was really good despite having destroyed our appetite and we over consumed as one will do when the stars of hunger, chips&salsa, followed by well prepared meals align.  I wanted to buy a t-shirt by the time we paid.  This is the new go to spot for Mexican on the West side for me.  Regular kind anyway. You want chef power you go to Momocho,  El Carniceo, or Barrio.  I guess we could eat Mexican every time we go out, but that would leave a lot of diverse tastes unsatisfied.

Low key spot, flavorful Mexican food at a decent price. We brought a big group here (many arriving mid-meal) and they were very fast and friendly serving us. I ordered tacos that came in like a deep-fried rolled tortilla - different than I expected, but they hit the spot!

I've been eating here for years, it's one of the best Mexican rants in Cleveland. Salsa is great, also the chicken tortilla soup. The potato-cheese chimichanga is great, as are the ground beef burritos, and chicken with mole sauce. I am never disappointed. Good food and not terribly expensive!

One of THE best Mexican places on the west side of Cleveland! Claire, Ashley, Jess, and Eddy provide the best service and most authentic Mexican food you'll find in Cleveland. Highly recommend trying. The margaritas are also worth your money.

To say this place has the worst etiquette I have ever experienced at any restaurant, is putting it lightly.  Extremely overpriced, awful food, awful service, disgusting practices, arrogant, inept owners.   It seems it has been pointed out over and over again on this website how appalling this place is, and the horrible ways in which the OWNERS themselves handle situations.  It seems they have no respect for their business, their staff, and least of all their customers.  
Stay away; please do not contribute to keeping these scumbags in business.

I had the best enchilada of my life at Luchita's.  It's surprisingly hard to find enchiladas with a verde sauce in Cleveland - at least in a restaurant that doesn't make me uncomfortable with crazy decorations. Or one that doesn't cook everything in pork fat.

Overall? Good food.  Free chips and salsa.  Fast service.  Lots of vegetarian options.  More margaritas than one person could conceivably drink in one sitting. It's definitely worth checking out.  There are multiple locations around Cleveland.
Still my favorite place for Mexican in NE Ohio. The salsa rocks.  Try the Burrito Mojato it's  my go-to menu item.

Was in from out of town visiting family. Went on a friday night on a recommendation from my uncle. Excellent experience. We were seated right away, and drinks came quick. Margaritas reasonably priced and tasted great! Food portions large (needed doggie bags), servers were very attentive and the food itself was great! Would definitely return when back in town!

I as always (for the 24+ years I have been coming here) can say the meal was excellent! I have had a few over the years had some less then perfect meals but we all have bad days occasionally. This food has spice and FLAVOR! I am not combining the two words, to much spice/heat is a waste of the meal; you taste nothing. You get just enough to wake up your taste buds and make the flavors come alive! My favorite? The ceviche! It's always slightly different by awesome!

I have grown to love Mexican food over the years. What sticks out to me about this place was the subtle acidity in everything ordered. I love sour/vinegar/citrus flavors! So that is what makes this place stand out to me. Also I was able to chow down on their pleasant patio on a breezy but balmy summer day.  Parking was easy too, especially in the off food rush  hours that we went. I will be back to try margaritas soon, fingers crossed. If you find your self here, do yourself a favor and order the crab appetizer!!
Great margaritas and I loved my food! Ordered the tacos americanos, my guilty pleasure, and the goat cheese guacamole. Everyone here was having a great time.

Severely underwhelmed by this place.  Sorry to be a hater, but the chips were slightly stale, the enchilada sauce was super salty, and the shredded chicken was very dry and bland.  The refried beans tasted sour for some reason.  Service was good, but all-in-all, there are better places for Mexican food in Cleveland.
Nice selection, beans are not fried in lard.  There is a nice patio when the weather is good.  Margaritas are excellent.

Luchita's Restaurant, located off the square in Hudson, is a Tex-Mex style Mexican restaurant. If I had to leave a one-word review, it would be 'meh'. The food is good, not great. The service is pleasant, but exceedingly average. The margaritas taste like mix, like you'd expect to see at some nondescript Mexican place. I had the Baja Carnitas and they were good but a little dry. The tortillas served alongside were given to me as an afterthought. I was expecting and upscale or innovated twist on the traditional Mexican fare served every, and that's not what I got. And I was hoping the bar would feature tequilas and make those step to the front in the margaritas; or even better, have a tequila menu or different tequila drinks. None of that. So if you're in the area and have a craving for Mexican, stop by. If you are looking to get blown away by a fresh and innovative way to prepare the same old ingredients, then this is not the place for you.
A really enjoyable Mexican restaurant experience! The food and drinks were wonderful and so was the service.
Service was fast and friendly. Food was fresh and served in a very timely manner. Couldn't ask for more from an apple empanada!

This place is amazing, a familiar haunt that never disappoints! The staff is great and hilarious, and the drinks are on point. If you are looking for a great time, sit at the bar and make friends with your neighbor, you will have a blast. The bartender gives me life, so funny and charming. The food is also always great, I recommend the Burro de Tabasco, one of the best I've had. I would recommend Luchitas to anyone I know

Hands Down my favorite Mexican food in town!
All the hip New Mexican places that have opened over the years while good in there own unique ways have nothing in this great cleveland Mexican food landmark.
Been coming here for over 25 years and still love it as much now as back then.

For starters! The queso fundido is amazing, with such a delicious blend of cheese and chorizo. 
The complimentary chips and salsa say it all! Large chunks of onion and cilantro accent this fresh tomato based salsa. The guacamole stands out as some of the best around. Never had a batch that wasn't  perfect.
 Chip get refilled frequently so be careful not to overdue it. You can fill up fast.

The 3 burrito combo is a fantastic deal , whether you get chicken or beef you cannot go wrong.

We just Love everything. Try the specials they change all the time but always worth a try. Even their little salad had a unique delicious taste. 
The staff is warm and welcoming! 
I truly hope they are around for years to come!

My 15 yr old daughter and 5 of her friends wanted a special evening last night. They made 6:30pm reservations the day before. They arrived 10 minutes early and were told they didn't have a table for them..... so they sat them (15 YEAR OLDS!!) at the bar!!  They all sat in a row and couldn't talk. They asked again for a regular table and were never given one. They were treated poorly and had terrible service. One of the girls received the wrong order and was given major attitude from the server when she spoke up. They were given their meals at the bar with no silverware and had to wait 10 minutes for silverware.  Just awful. We will never be back.  Shameful way to treat customers regardless of the age.

Really nice. Traveling across the country to Seattle. Delicious ground beef enchiladas with red salsa! Also, full points on the margaritas. 

After the warm meal, now I'm back in the car. I tell my boyfriend I'm writing a review on yelp, and he asks: "how many stars are you giving it?"

"5"

"Good."

Really great Mexican food, not to mention the margs are delish! You can get a pitcher for $15, it will give you about 6 cups full of drinks, pretty good size for two people. We also stuffed our face with the complimentary chips and salsa-so good! It's making my mouth water just thinking about them. I had the chimichanga and asked for cheese sauce on the side, my oh my! My taste buds were in taste bud heaven that's for sure, I finished the whole plate and even contemplated licking it clean.

We have been to Luchitas twice this month. They have a skinny margarita that is amazing. The waitresses are friendly and generous with the chips & salsa. The food was so delicious and I didn't leave feeling stuffed which often happens with Mexican food. There have been several owners so if you haven't been recently I highly recommend.

On the west side, this is one of the best spots to get great Mexican food.  The decor is nice, the service is friendly, but the food-very good.  To me the food here sets itself apart from other Mexican places because it tastes homemade.

Excellent Margaritas by the pitcher!  Expect a wait during peak hours.

Looking for a perfect Mexican restaurant? Found one! For starters, we like to eat late on the weekends. 10:30 PM, is our start time for dinner. Luchita's stays open until midnight.
The Hostess greeted us and was very friendly, as she seated us in a back corner.
I ordered the Cheese Enchiladas. Portions are very liberal.
The dinner comes with rice and vegetarian beans. The meal was so appealing. It also came out within 7 minutes.The flavoring was just right. The Waitress was so friendly and helpful.
The atmosphere was great. Even though the bar crowd was very alive, the wall between the bar and the dining area was great for acoustics. We could talk without having to raise our voices. In the summer months, they also have a perfect patio outside.College kids and 20-30 something's love to regroup here. But Hudson neighbors also abound. The meal for  2 was 26.00.
There is something for everyone on the menu And the menu has a glossary of terms,
How refreshing!
Here is the icing on the cake, as we were leaving, the Owner came out to thank us for coming in. I loved the care, the food and service here! This is a perfect Mexican restaurant. It has everything you could ask for in a Mexican Restaurant.
P.S. the Salsa is great and has a punch to it!

To further muddy the waters?  Guess it really doesn't matter, except you can't use the same coupons or "check in" freebies at all.  FB message sent to Luchitas @117th"


Me: There's seems to be some Luchita's confusion in the area. Are you affiliated with Luchita's in Parma? 


31 minutes ago  Like  
Response:  Luchita's Mexican Restaurant Cleveland They are a Luchita's but they're more autonomous. They have their FaceBook page that appears to be here

Was really disappointed. Queso Fundido was a giant mound of melted cheese with very little chorizo sprinkled in. The corn tortillas it was served with tasted old and stale and almost crumbled apart in my hands. The enchilada w/ their "special mole" was flavorless. There was no spice to it, nothing Mexican tasting about it. A very sad mole. The Mexican rice tasted like the plastic container it must have been sitting in for a while. 

And I agree with Jason, it is a dump. This doesn't even qualify as a dive. For the most part, I like dive joints. Nothing makes sense inside this location and it just feels like an awkward, uncomfortable environment. 

Will stick with the Parma location, where their food actually tastes like Mexican food.

Our goto Mexican restaurant in the Hudson/twinsburg/Macedonia area.  Management is friendly and food is great.  I have had several seafood platters that were excellent.   Their margaritas are also excellent.   You will find a wait on weekend nights but you can walk around downtown Hudson until you receive a text that your table is ready.  Atmosphere is nice,  with dim lighting and a beautiful bar in the middle of the area.

My two recent visits were an example of a poorly run restaurant. The walls and floor are so dirty plus the wall of bottles have been never dusted.
This week visit they tried to sit us in the dining room were 60% of the tables were full of dirty dishes and the waiters were hanging out on there phones and eating food while chatting with bartender and a friend we decided not to eat that night
Tables should be cleared immediately 
Cleaning should be done every night all the time

My friends and I went to this restaurant and it turned out to be an utter disappointment. The food was ok but the service was very disappointing. The employees did not respect us and when we got the bill, the tip was already included which made us very annoyed and uncomfortable. Then, when getting the bill, two of our checks were messed up and they did not give us back the correct amount in return. So rude and so disappointing.

I just discovered this place today. SO good. I'm here now and trying everything on the menu- seems like it anyway. This place rocks. I would drive for hours for the queso fundido. I'm now obsessed. You have to try it.

I must say I used to live in this area for 20 years and very much regret not eating here . I had a Chicken Burrito and a chicken Enchilada excellent flavor and quantity. Nice clean decor and very simple restaurant! The Margaritas finally someone pours a nice amount of liqueur in their Margaritas. Very nice impression for my first time eating here.

I was tired today from working too much, was off today and wanted to stop and take lunch home.  This was my 1st visit.  I ordered the vegetarian tostadas, plus 2 bean enchiladas on the side.  With the chips and salsa they give you, I had lunch AND dinner.  I sat at the bar and waited for my order.  This is an older place, and has a dive-y feel, but in a good way.  I noticed that in spite of the age, the place was spotlessly clean; in fact, I detected a hint of floor cleaner scent.  This doesn't bother me--better than the place being dirty!  The bartender was very nice.

I got home, and tasted the salsa--delish!!  Yum!!  The tostadas were tasty, but I especially liked the bean enchiladas with red sauce.  Very tasty--my favorite thing.  I'm giving only 4 stars because the chips were a little stale--leftovers from yesterday, maybe?  I crisped them up in the oven.  All in all, I will return.  Yummy food!
Love it!!! Mango Marg was great! Ceviche best I have ever had!  Fajita salad superb!!!

I've been going to Luchita's for  many years - over 25 years.  It's been thru
a lot of changes but the food has always remained consistent and very good.
The best Mexican you'll get in the area. 
Azteca (house soup) is wonderful. Good chicken flavor topped with avocado. Sometimes a little bit too salty.
Very good salsa and chips.  Burritos, enchaladas, tacos all good. 
Service has always been good.  It can get expensive drinking here, especially
if you like margaritas.  (But it is not a drinkers bar.)
Atmosphere is comfortable and clean.
Good food and beers on tap.
Delicious Mexican and conveniently located outside of Cleveland. Great place to eat on the way to downtown. Whether coming up 71 or 90 eastbound a quick hop of the highway for some good food.

Taco Tuesdays and Enchilada Wednesdays. I am skeptical about bug reports. If you are turned off by roaches, you might as well never eat again. The world we live in is buggy. Bugs go where the food is, kind of like us. They are just trying to live. I am going to go back.

Very disappointing. Even more disappointing if you're familiar with the quality of other Luchita's locations.

I could always count on excellent taste and service at the Luchita's on W. 117th in Cleveland (and a now-closed operation in Mentor). The menu went past the usual AmeriMex to include more authentic choices.

Went to the Hudson Luchita's on a Thursday evening. With the restaurant half-full, I was led past many empty tables to a spot right next to the (cold-leaking) window. Service was brusque. Menu was more limited than the others, which wasn't promising.

The cheese-and-poblano tamales were odd. Two tamales, one covered with red sauce and one with green, but slopped together so the sauces mostly blended. The red-sauced tamale had a very thin vein of filling, perhaps shoelace-sized, with a few shreds of poblano and threads of cheese. I had to go through 80% of the length of the other one before I finally found two shreds of pepper and a small glob of cheese; most of it was just cornmeal all the way through. Dry cornmeal.

My main course was the tinga de pollo, which was one of my faves from Mentor. But when I lifted a forkful of this tinga, I revealed a deep pool of watery liquid. The chicken itself was extremely salty, masking other flavors.

A minor point, but the waitress did that annoying thing where, when you agree to a water refill, she whisks away your half-full glass and you have to wait for her to putter around the other tables before you finally get it back. And then she stuck it at the far end of the table from me -- literally up to the edge.

Dear Mr. Luchita,
As a regular contributor to Yelp, I usually like to give an establishment a couple of tries before I post my critique.  My first experience at Luchita's was 6 years ago, and because it was not quite stellar, we thought we'd give you some time to get it right. Time's up!   

I am a corporate trainer who  works with caregivers to improve their skills in providing patients with a positive experience.  I suggest your employees could use some training in dealing with the public!

First, upon entering, we were looked at as though we were intruders. "Oh God, we've got customers."  Come on, this is Hudson!  You can do better than that!

Second, I wouldn't exactly call your employee D******** a "Server" as service is not what she gave us!  With only 3 tables occupied at 5 pm on a Friday night with a handful of servers on staff, she seemed more interested in hiding in the back room than she did doing her job.  The lack of attention is a clear indication of management in absentia!

We had to seek service from a couple other employees to get one water refill for my husband ... and the bill. Another server filled my husband's glass. Eventually D***** delivered the check, pitching it onto the table from a distance of 4 feet..with her back turned, muttering something under her breath like, "There you go."   She should try for the Minor Leagues, for a server she is not!  

At least she warned us about the dangerously hot dish delivered within 3 minutes of our order, meaning one thing--- microwaved food!  The order was accurate, the food, and particularly the sauce, was lackluster with a finish of industrial, the music was New Age!  Come on...how about some Mariachi with our prepackaged entrees?

Needless to say, what a disappointment--Especially considering your location!  Guess that's why I don't know anyone who has darkened your door since we visited the last time.  

PS. The Sangria was tasty!

Twice refused to take my groupon for unprinted 'rules'. Forgot to bring an entree and everyone done before I could catch someone's attention to ask. Not my fave Mexican anymore. And the bus boy was wiping tables with a rag that hit the floor. Classy all around.
Service is pretty awesome as well as food . I was surprised it only had 3.5 stars. Wednesday's special is $2 enchiladas & they are sooooo good.

The chimichangas were alright, not bad. Guacamole was pretty fake-tasting and bland, salsa was disappointing as well. Chips were unenjoyable. The rice looks like bad fried rice from a Chinese food court and tastes not quite as good.

Great place to unwind. Food is amazing. This week's special is great. Tostadas con poll en chorizo. (Chicken and chrizo on a crispy tortilla with pickled red onions lettuce and tomato.) Worth a try.  The margaritas are the best in town. If you haven't been here before or in a while, give it a try.

For a low key, hole in the wall little bar/restaurant, the tacos here were amazing. It's all I've had on the menu, but it's a cool little spot regardless. Dark set ambiance. Definitely authentic cuisine. It's in a remote location off of 117th and you would probably never think of stopping in there, if you even noticed it, but it's definitely worth it. 

I have not been back since the first time, I was 21 I believe, wow time flies, I'm an old man now. Hahaha. I have it bookmarked and will attend sometime in the near future. Stay tuned for an update, a lot can happen in 63 years.

For the price and location you are not going to find a better Mexican restaurant. I went here for years however I've since moved away but went her the other week and am happy to report that it's just as good as always.

My husband, daughter and I just moved here from Cincinnati for his job, and we tried Luchita's last night. It was a totally random pick because we had driven into Hudson for dinner and it was one of 2 restaurants open at First and Main (Memorial Day). 
I didn't drink, although a margarita sounded great (will have to indulge next time), but we got some queso to start. Totally not the Mexican queso I am use to, but I thought it was awesome. It had huge chunks of veggies in it (made me feel less guilty....my weight watchers plan is not going so well). For dinner I had a combo - the veggie enchilada (spinach/cheese/potato) with red sauce, and a beef taco. Both were awesome, and not to greasy. 
The only "bad" thing I can say is that it took at least 30 minutes to get our food. There was a huge party in front of us whose order must have gone in first. But it was worth it and they were very friendly. We will def go back!!

This is the worst Mexican restaurant in the area!  I've eaten at many Mexican restaurants all over the country and this restaurant is very poor. The service was great. Stop there. The menu is limited. The flan is the worst I've ever had!  It was full of holes. Not creamy like a good flan should I be. I brought half home and have decided to throw it away. It's not worth the calories. I've never written such a bad review before and hope I never do again.

Wow, this place used to be so much better.  Went last night and the food and service was crap.  They messed up the orders and I was the last person at a table of 7 to get my food.  The shredded chicken was dry and overly smothered with mole sauce.  My friend's tamales looked awful.  My mom asked for sauce on the side, which they ignored.  Waited forever to get our drinks. Then they messed up the bills.  Can you say disaster? Never going back.

I wish I lived closer to Luchita's - well, I guess I live close to A luchita's but not this one. The hudson location is much better than the cleveland one. And, it's probably a good thing I don't live closer, or I'd be about 50 lbs heavier!! I've been to this location multiple times in the past few months and I have to say, it's one of my favorite mex restaurants in NEO. Love their chips and salsa. Their queso is wonderful too!! 

If you're in the mood for margs, I'd definitely recommend getting the margarita flight. You get a sampler of three margaritas of the bartender's choice - and by sampler I mean a glass of each. Get a few amongst your friends and t's a great way to try margs and an even greater way to get tipsy fast.

I love sitting out on the patio in the summer, but inside is just as good in the winter. The waiters/waitresses are all super friendly and on slow days when they have time, fun to talk to. I've never had a trip there with poor service and like I said, I've been about 6 times between July and last week. 

I fell in love with their cheese and potato enchiladas, so basically never steer away from it when I go. It's so different from other mexican restaurants and I was a bit hesitant to try it the first time around, but the waitress highly recommended it and I haven't looked back since! It's basically a pureed blend of potato, spinach, etc (the two things I can actually see) which is mixed with cheese. I got the mole sauce once but didn't like the sweet flavor so have gotten the enchiladas with the red sauce ever since.... LOVE....

I also love the area that Luchita's is in. SUPER cute - First and Main. Parking can suck if it's a weekend or weeknight, but you'll eventually find a spot- Just keep swimming... food is worth it :)

Awful! The floors were dirty as if they were brushing food off the tables and just leaving it there all day. The seats in our booth were torn. My margarita was served in a solo cup and it tasted like margarita mix and our Burrito was bland. Other than the excellent location, I really can't think of a positive.
I have a hard time understanding why people like this place?? The only Mexican I had worse than Luchita's is Zocalo on E. 4th downtown.  Bleech.  Stay away from both places!!
